byline.contributor: Arielle Dollinger reported from Central Islip, and Rick Rojas from New York.
byline.original: By ARIELLE DOLLINGER and RICK ROJAS

abstract: Suffolk County grand jury indicts limousine driver Carlos F Pino for 2015 collision in Cutchogue, NY, that killed four passengers; charges include criminally negligent homicide and reckless driving.
lead_paragraph: The driver of a pickup truck that struck the limousine faces charges of drunken driving but, even sober, he could not have avoided the collision, prosecutors said.

headline.main: Limousine Driver Is Indicted in Crash That Killed 4 Women on Long Island
headline.print_headline: Limousine Driver Is Indicted in Crash That Killed 4 Women on Long Island

snippet: The driver of a pickup truck that struck the limousine faces charges of drunken driving but, even sober, he could not have avoided the collision, prosecutors said.
